channel.title: BBC News - England

item.title: Channel crossings: RNLI chief hits out over migrant rescue abuse
item.description: The RNLI boss spoke out after it emerged lifeboat crews were being heckled for rescuing migrants.

item.title: Victoria Hall: Man arrested in 1999 teen murder case
item.description: Victoria Hall, 17, was abducted on her way home from a Suffolk nightclub more than 20 years ago.

item.title: Richmond School teacher trampled to death by cows, inquest hears
item.description: David Clark died after being trampled by a herd of cows while walking his dogs in North Yorkshire.

item.title: Trafford General: Lightning strike sets hospital roof on fire
item.description: Some patients and staff are evacuated as fire crews tackle the blaze at Trafford General Hospital.

item.title: Bristol Rovers president Wael al-Qadi apologises for Joey Barton statement
item.description: The club's president says anyone found guilty of violent offences "will be dismissed immediately".

item.title: Ashby Ville: Boy, 14, dies in lake at Scunthorpe nature reserve
item.description: The 14-year-old boy's body was recovered from the lake at Ashby Ville in Scunthorpe, say police.

item.title: Worksop chimney sweeps find Santa letter lost for decades
item.description: The slightly burnt note asks for a "cowboy suit and guns and a hat and everything".

item.title: Sheffield Forgemasters: Ministry of Defence to acquire steel firm
item.description: Sheffield Forgemasters will see up to £400m of investment in the next decade, the government says.

item.title: Wayne Rooney: Police drop blackmail complaint
item.description: Police say no offences have taken place regarding the social media photographs of Wayne Rooney.

item.title: Covid: Deaf woman wins claim over lack of sign language at briefings
item.description: A lack of sign language at two government briefings was discriminatory, a High Court judge finds.

item.title: Matt Hancock: Newmarket Town Council passes no-confidence vote
item.description: A council in the former health secretary's constituency accuses the MP of "hypocrisy and hubris".

item.title: Judith Fox: Woman killed and dismembered mother jury finds
item.description: Lucy Fox was given a hospital order after being diagnosed with a paranoid illness.

item.title: Covid: Which children are being vaccinated and why?
item.description: Hundreds of thousands of children at higher risk from coronavirus infection will be offered a Covid vaccine in the UK.

item.title: Why you shouldn't get a second Covid jab too early
item.description: A government scientific advisor tells Newsbeat why four weeks is too soon between Covid jabs.

item.title: Beta coronavirus variant: What is the risk?
item.description: There are fears that this version of coronavirus, first identified in South Africa, is

item.title: Covid rules: How can the clinically vulnerable stay safe?
item.description: As social-distancing and other Covid rules end in England, how can people who were shielding stay safe?

item.title: What are the rules and guidance for face masks and coverings from 19 July?
item.description: Masks are no longer compulsory in England, but remain necessary in Scotland and Wales.

item.title: Channel crossings: RNLI release footage of rescue
item.description: The video shows about 12 people, including young children, in a dinghy being pulled to safety.

item.title: Aerial dancers enjoy striking Honister sunrise performance
item.description: Three aerial dancers suspend themselves from 1,000ft (305m) up for a routine in the Lake District.

item.title: New agricultural techniques trialled in Devon
item.description: A South West nature reserve is pioneering new agricultural techniques as part of a UK-wide scheme.

item.title: Prince Philip: 'Surreal' letter from palace after royal portrait
item.description: Honor sent a painting to the Queen after the prince's death and was surprised at the response.

item.title: Woman hikes 88 peaks in memory of mum
item.description: Lucy Coppack climbed to honour her mum, who designed one of the trig pillars marking the highest points.

item.title: US visa granted to seriously ill girl, 2
item.description: Medics say Alta Fixsler has no chance of recovery but her parents want her to be treated abroad.

item.title: Covid-19: Great Yarmouth mayor resigns over breach of rules
item.description: A town's mayor steps down a week after being suspended by her political party.

item.title: Fake or Fortune?: Norfolk found 'Henry Moore sculpture' could be worth £1m
item.description: Could a sculpture found in long grass be a lost work by one of the greatest 20th Century artists?

item.title: Prince Charles attends Staffordshire police memorial dedication
item.description: The new national memorial to fallen officers and staff honours "courageous sacrifice".

item.title: West Suffolk Hospital: 'Witch hunt' NHS Trust boss steps down
item.description: Dr Stephen Dunn was chief executive at a hospital when staff were asked to submit fingerprints.

item.title: Escaped 6ft boa constrictor in Measham found in shed
item.description: Owner Shannon Surch says Bo the snake was found just yards from the house among her pet rabbits.

item.title: Funnel cloud spotted near Daventry as storms move in
item.description: Onlookers say it started off as a "wispy cloud" but got "bigger and closer to the ground".

item.title: Tom Dean: double Olympic gold medallist's raw talent
item.description: University of Bath student Tom Dean twice recovered from Covid on the way to Tokyo Olympic success.

item.title: Relay gold and sculling silver for GB - what's happened on day five?
item.description: Charlotte Dujardin wins dressage bronze to become the most decorated British female Olympian, as Team GB's swimmers secure gold.

item.title: The Hundred: Bad weather wipes out Manchester Originals v Northern Superchargers
item.description: Manchester Originals match against Northern Superchargers in the women's Hundred is abandoned without a ball being bowled.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Charlotte Dujardin wins dressage bronze to become most decorated female Briton
item.description: Great Britain's Charlotte Dujardin becomes Great Britain's most decorated female Olympian by winning dressage bronze at Tokyo 2020.
